description: Creates an HSM client certificate that an Amazon Redshift cluster will use to connect to the client's HSM in order to store and retrieve the keys used to encrypt the cluster databases. The command returns a public key, which you must store in the HSM. In addition to creating the HSM certificate, you must create an Amazon Redshift HSM configuration that provides a cluster the information needed to store and use encryption keys in the HSM. For more information, go to Hardware Security Modules in the Amazon Redshift Cluster Management Guide.

parameters.name: HsmClientCertificateIdentifier
parameters.description: The identifier to be assigned to the new HSM client certificate that the cluster will use to connect to the HSM to use the database encryption keys.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: A list of tag instances. (dict) --- A tag consisting of a name/value pair for a resource. Key (string) --- The key, or name, for the resource tag. Value (string) --- The value for the resource tag.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: The key, or name, for the resource tag.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The value for the resource tag.

nested_items.name: HsmClientCertificate
nested_items.description: Returns information about an HSM client certificate. The certificate is stored in a secure Hardware Storage Module (HSM), and used by the Amazon Redshift cluster to encrypt data files.

nested_items.name: HsmClientCertificateIdentifier
nested_items.description: The identifier of the HSM client certificate.

nested_items.name: HsmClientCertificatePublicKey
nested_items.description: The public key that the Amazon Redshift cluster will use to connect to the HSM. You must register the public key in the HSM.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: The list of tags for the HSM client certificate.
